cab.content: SECRET Copy No. 44W.M. (41)6th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 6 (41).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10, Downing Street,S. W: 1, on Tuesday, January 14, 1941, at 12-30 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Lord Privy Seal (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson, The Right Hon, Anthony Eden, M.P..M.P., Lord President of the Council. Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. A. Greenwood, M.P., The Right Hon. Sir Kingsley Wood,Minister without Portfolio. M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. P2rnest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and Minister ofNational Service.Sir Edward Bridges, Secretary.Contents.minute no. Subject. page 1. Production .................... ........ 30Excess Profits Tax.2. The Balkans............................. 30.. German intentions.[22125]THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. January 1941. Production.Excess profits tax.(previous reference:W.M. (41) 3rdConclusions,Minute 2.)1. The War Cabinet again had under consideration the effectof the present arrangements in regard to Excess Profits Tax.A record of the discussion and of the Conclusions reached is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.The Balkans. 2. The War Cabinet had before them telegrams Nos. 61, 62German and 64 from our Minister at Belgrade, reporting the attitude of the intentions. Yugo-Slav Government.(Previous The Foreign Secretary read out the telegrams (Nos. 64 and 66Reference: to Belgrade) which he proposed to send, subject to the concurrenceW.M. (41) 5th of the Chiefs of Staff.Conclusions, A fuller record of the discussion is contained in the Secretary'sMinute 2.) Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.The War Cabinet approved the line of action proposed.Great George Street, S. W. 1,January 14, 1941.
